Detailed Description

Provides a list view with basic cut/paste facilities.

This class provides a QListView with added functionality to allow copy/cut/paste oeprations to be performed. See the QT documentation for further details about QListView. Items are treated as whole rows, as a list view does not allow individual columns to be selected.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum cfg_ListView::validData
 

enum of return values for validData

Enumerator:
DATA_VALID  This row is valid
DATA_INVALID  This row is invalid, return to previous contents
DATA_ALL_VALID  All rows are valid, do not ask again
CANCEL  Cancel the paste, and return all rows to previous states

Member Function Documentation

void cfg_ListView::clipboardDataValid (  bool   )  [signal]
 

Signal issued when the data on the clipboard has changed, indicating if it is suitable to paste, or not.

void cfg_ListView::copyToClipboard (   )  [slot]
 

The function cfg_ListView::copyToClipboard() copies the selected items to the clipboard

Returns:
void

void cfg_ListView::dataPasted (   )  [signal]
 

Signal issued when data has been pasted, allowing the application to check the table, at this point undoPaste() can be called if the changes need to be undone.

void cfg_ListView::deleteItems (   )  [slot]
 

The function cfg_ListView::deleteItems() deletes the currently selected items

Returns:
void

void cfg_ListView::insertData (   )  [slot]
 

The function cfg_ListView::insertData() inserts new rows from the clipboard. As each row is modified the function validateRow(int iRow) is called, this can be used to check the row as it is inserted. When all the data has been pasted the signal dataPasted() will be emmited, at that point you may want to call undoPaste() if the table is not valid anymore.

Returns:
void

QListViewItem * cfg_ListView::newItem (  QListView *  parent,
QListViewItem *  after
)  [protected, virtual]
 

The function cfg_ListView::newItem(QListView* parent, QListViewItem * after) creates a new QListViewItem item, override this if you want to use a class derived from QListViewItem, for example you may want to highlight invalid rows.

Parameters:
QListView* parent
QListViewItem* after
Returns:
QListViewItem*

void cfg_ListView::replaceData (   )  [slot]
 

The function cfg_ListView::replaceData() replaces the selected rows with data from the clipboard. If cfg_ListView::bClearSpareColumns is true all columns will be cleared before inserting new data. If the number of rows selected does not match the number of rows in the clipboard the remaining rows will be created or deleted as appropriate.

As each row is modified the function validateRow(QListViewItem * lvi) is called, this can be used to check the row as it is inserted. When all the data has been pasted the signal dataPasted() will be emmited, at that point you may want to call undoPaste() if the table is not valid anymore.

Returns:
void

void cfg_ListView::undoPaste (   )  [slot]
 

The function cfg_ListView::undoPaste() undoes the last paste operation.

Returns:
void

int cfg_ListView::validateRow (  QListViewItem *  lvi  )  [protected, virtual]
 

The function cfg_ListView::validateRow(QListViewItem *lvi) is the default function to validate row, that can be overriden by a class that inherits this class to perform application specific validation. This function returns cfg_ListView::validData.

Parameters:
QListViewItem *lvi pointer to the entry to validate
Returns:
int This should be cfg_ListView::validData

Member Data Documentation

bool cfg_ListView::bClearSpareColumns
 

If true when replaceData() is called all data in un-pasted columns will be cleared, the default is false.
